title: What i dont get about the assassins rework
body:
When old LeBlanc had to do a full rotation at short range to burst a squishy it was considered "unhealthy" and they reworked her to where she has to die before getting her burst off, and needs to buy Gunblade+LichBane to be able to burst a target down.

When current Talon/Nocturne/Draven (dravens an assassin at this point) AA you once  and kill you, theres apparentally nothing wrong with that and considered balanced, while LeBlanc is constantly complained about.

"omg she just has to hit her global chain and then i die! WTF rito nerf!" (This doesnt actually happen)

Yet you never hear

"Nocturne just jumped across 1/5 of the map and blinded my entire team, then oneshot me with an AA! WTF!"

Oh well, guess ill continue to die before trying to Proc my Sigil Of Malice on the enemy carry. Keep nerfing her please.

K let's break this mage main bs down. BTW gonna add this in as a general statement to anyone. Yes duskblade is stupid but this is what happens when we gut ad assassin kits this hard riot has to make insane items like this so they can actually function.

> When old LeBlanc had to do a full rotation at short range to burst a squishy it was considered &quot;unhealthy&quot; and they reworked her to where she has to die before getting her burst off, and needs to buy Gunblade+LichBane to be able to burst a target down.

Short compared to other ap champions sure but it wasn't that short especially considering she has a dash and her burst was fast. 

They reworked her because most people hated playing against her and they have no avenues to buff her when he playstyle is oh hi im here and you are now dead. 


> When current Talon/Nocturne/Draven (dravens an assassin at this point) AA you once  and kill you, theres apparentally nothing wrong with that and considered balanced, while LeBlanc is constantly complained about.

This literally isn't happening which is why no one is complaining about it. You won't see complaints about hyperbole people complain about reality. In reality they all use most of their kit when killing you unless they are insanely fed which riot doesn't balance around. People have only really complained about draven. Recently most people on this forum who post about leblanc want old leblanc back.


> &quot;omg she just has to hit her global chain and then i die! WTF rito nerf!&quot; (This doesnt actually happen)

> Yet you never hear

I saw james the mage and saw he mostly plays mages. I'm not gonna lie some strong assumptions were made.
I wonder that to. Many others can oneshot and it feels unfair that we don't have an assassin that came from an assassin rework plz change her back riot !

The main difference is that Leblanc get's an near-instant out after doing so, instead of committing like those others you listed. And Draven is not assassin, he's equally complained about, but he's not an assassin.
yeah... and he's complained about cause he deal so much without being an assassin
He also has no mobility, so he has to run at you from a bush to catch you unaware. Proper positioning in teamfights, with focus on him, is easily solved.

Riot has a similar bias with mages, they had their will of the ancients removed because 'burst healing is unhealthy', meanwhile marksmen can heal a major chunk of their health with every critical hit on lifesteal. Which they don't even need to build, thanks to the mastery rework. At least mages were gated by mana and cooldowns, ontop of most spells being dodgable; unlike auto-attacks being unavoidable as well as spamable.
No, Will of the Ancients was removed because it could never be strong without Vlad abusing it. Even if it gave only Mana, Vlad would abuse it.
So one champion was a problem but he got reworked. However the bloodlust mastery was abused by the majority of marksmen, both before & after it's rework.

He got reworked, and yet would still continue to abuse it, because no Vlad player would pass up 15% increased healing based on damage. Spellvamp is extremely broken on Vlad, and will continue to be. 

And, no? Bloodlust isn't being abused, because they're the ones meant to use it. Even then, you're lying if you're trying to tell me that Bloodlust as it is now, is the same level of BS it was before.

Yet there's no cap on lifesteal, scales with critical hits and attack speed, and it's immediate. 
At least vladimir's abilities cost health, have noticeably longer cast animations, and have cooldowns. 
Just because they aren't meant to use it, doesn't mean they won't; just ask ezreal.

> "Nocturne just jumped across 1/5 of the map and blinded my entire team, then oneshot me with an AA! WTF!"

Because Nocturne cant oneshot you with an AA unless he is massively fed and builds completly glass cannon. Also the 1 time out of 10000 that he goes laning he is kinda crappy at it, while LB had all her power in completly shutting down whoever poor victim tried to lane against her.

On topic, because LB has a shitload of independant mobility and her burst pattern was absolutely obnoxious in lane, while those you mentioned either are inmobile, or dive in to not blink back.

The real problem is that LB is stuck in a terrible underlying champion design, of which there are two outcomes, both which Riot doesnt want.

People say it's not enough to oneshot when started that way, but I did it to an 0/0 jungle Graves when I was 0/0.

E+R+auto+Qcrit+auto (Q is an auto reset and can be used to animation cancel the first auto)+W and you're dead. Ignite for bonus lols, or for level 6 where that's not quite enough damage.
